result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Van De Hey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Psilocin(>100-500g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(g)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 10-19-16; unpaid supervision fees of $480

Defendant Matthew T Van De Hey in court, in custody with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing recommendation agreed upon by counsel.  Defendant made statement to Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in jail.  A civil judgment will be entered for any unpaid financial obligations.  164 days jail credit.  10:05/10:20

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew T Van De Hey in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.Information filed, reading waived.

Defendant Matthew T Van De Hey in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conds: 30 days jail, huber, start date to be determined by agent, may transfer to Outagamie Cty. Jail. $518 costs. Submit DNA sample, pay surcharge. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Review in 6  months. Court granted 3 days jail credit.

Defendant Matthew T Van De Hey in court with attorney Ryan S Ulrich.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $5,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, waives time limits to prelim  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
